website_summaries.verdict: The least expensive option for the single coffee lover or office worker who wants to avoid waste and loves convenience.
pros: Great option for travel and coffee on the go because of its lightweight and durable construction
Fits on virtually any mug and is dishwasher safe
cons: Only useful for single cup serving
not a good option for serving multiple people
It's also not as stylish as many other options

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Cup O Joe Every Morning
customer_reviews.text: I love this pour-over! I have bought some for my family as well and they love them! Fits over most sizes of coffee cups and uses #2 coffee filters. My husband likes his coffee strong while I like mine mild - so we boil a kettle and are able to have our own perfect cup of coffee! Tip: put your cream and sugar in the cup before you pour-over the coffee - that way it will mix as it brews! If you found my review helpful, please click Yes below! :)
customer_reviews.author: madeline audreyTop Contributor: Health & Wellness

customer_reviews.title: Superior taste
customer_reviews.text: I did a taste test between pour-over and aeropress, and the pour-over won by a definite margin. It does take a little longer to get the coffee into the cup, though. Basket filters are less than a penny apiece at the grocery store, but are a little large for the Melitta cone. However, the excess can be gathered and clipped fairly easily, as shown in pic.
customer_reviews.author: limestone_lenny

customer_reviews.title: I don't like the new design as this one does not fit ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the new design as this one does not fit many cups like the original design that had another inner ring that can accommodate various size of cup rim sizes. Now I have to use for cup that fits and then transfer to my thermal to take coffee with me. Also I don't like the hole at the bottom. I see why it was designed that way...to see content level but it does make your coffee cold significantly faster. I usually have ok idea of how much water I need so that hole is useless for me.
customer_reviews.author: Shanna C.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Functional
customer_reviews.text: Good cup of coffee, no longer piping hot once it's ready, but decent enough. Have to keep refilling to make a full cup. Will be great for RV where we have limited water when boondocking and no electric (and BF is not a fan of instant - ah well, who is?). Just lift out the filter and rinse. The product itself is flawless - sits on cup well, can see the contents of the cup, comes with a couple #2 filters in each to try. Will probably survive the apocalypse.
customer_reviews.author: Bobblefrog

customer_reviews.title: cup coffee brewer that needs filters to be put in and thus bought after buying the brewer
customer_reviews.text: I bougth years ago and use a two black coffee brewers that are together one coffee cup makers...... the first cup has no top and you put in the coffee grounds for one cup to drink...... then you put the second cup on that has a gold hearty plastic filter in its bottom ----- so you put the coffee in first put top on and pour boiling water and make a delicious cup of coffee..................love em the two i bought and i thought i could get something like that with the ones i bought.... but nooooooooo-- i bought for my daughter and now she is seeking filters.........i am dissappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon fan!!Big time

customer_reviews.title: A delicious and easy cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy to use and maintain this is. I only like 1 very strong cup so this is less hassle and waste than using our electric coffee maker with a minimum of 4 cups. It makes the most delicious cup of coffee so our fancy Mr. Coffee will be just for my husband who likes to drink whole pots on his own. This is perfect for camping and to use during hurricanes. I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: J. B. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Changed my life
customer_reviews.text: Its ridiculous how life changing this little coffee cone is. I bought it to use at my desk at work, since I like to drink coffee sporadically throughout the day and I don't like the hassle of dumping out and cleaning the office pot all day. This thing is easy to use and wipes clean. It doesn't leave any plastic taste in my coffee, and it allows me to have multiple fresh cups of coffee a day. I can't recommend this enough.
customer_reviews.author: Lexibrooke1

customer_reviews.title: Can’t go wrong !
customer_reviews.text: I already had a couple at home so I knew what I was getting. Whenever we have guests and they have coffee ,they love this system of one cup at a time. Ready Set Joe single cup coffee is so simple to make and control how weak or strong each cup is. You are in control with the one cup filter holder. You also get the filters that fit so you can’t go wrong with this.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Melita does it right. I accidentally left my Melita pour-over coffee cone in Hawaii. After looking on Amazon for a "new and improved" replacement, I opted to replace it with the "not so new or improved" option. It may not be ceramic, large, colorful, or esthetically appealing, but I find it does the job for half to two-third the price. Works for me! If you're looking for cost/function, Melita coffee cone is my recommendation!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Drain Hole Too Small
customer_reviews.text: This would be a perfect product if not for the tiny hole at the bottom the coffee drains out of. The hole is WAY too small and it literally takes me 15 minutes to brew a single cup of coffee because I have to wait forever for it to drain through. One of my coworkers brought in a stainless steel version of this and the hole at the bottom was much bigger in diameter. That one worked perfectly and I had the same cup of pour over coffee in maybe five minutes. I might try to rig something to make the hole bigger on this plastic one from Melitta. Pour design overall though.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Wilson

customer_reviews.title: New Design-Pros and Cons
customer_reviews.text: This is a different design than my old (almost paleolithic) Melitta single cup brewer. It seems to be designed to fit onto a larger variety of containers, and it has a big opening (as you can see in the photos). Cons: it wobbles on many of my mugs, and the big opening lets heat escape during brewing. I need to preheat the mug to get a really hot cup of coffee. Pros: it works just as well as the old design, and the big opening lets me see how full the mug is--so none of the absent-minded over-pours to clean up. Overall: I'm satisfied and recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: MAE

customer_reviews.title: Best single cup brewer I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying I would not understand why someone would give this a one-star review. This Brewer is very solidly built and is easy to clean. With a little practice you can Brew every cup of coffee like a pro. I even enjoy using this Brewer more than an expensive Keurig machine since all my coffee comes out tasting so much better. This is by far the best single-cup Brewer on the market. Over the years I've tried many Brewers and this one works the best. The hole on the bottom is just the right size to allow the coffee to seep for the right amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great improvement: built-in window to view coffee level in cup!
customer_reviews.text: I like the design of these, better than the usual ones, cuz they have a peep hole so you can see the level of coffee in the cup below. .rather than having to lift the unit up and peek to be sure when to stop pouring hot water so your coffee cup doesn't overflow, or get too full for cream. A tiny little improvement over the old design everybody's used for a billion years, but what a nice little joy to use once you've discovered it. Good job, product designers!
customer_reviews.author: Design Magic

customer_reviews.title: Simple yet perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of those fancy glass pour over coffee makers, only to find the included filter was garbage and tons of grounds got through. So, I set out to find an alternative filter to use without getting rid of my nice glass carafe. Lots of metal mesh filters had terrible reviews. Then I found this and it's like a little plastic piece of heaven. I get my nice slow brewed pour over, and there's not a ground in sight. It even fits directly over my cup for when it's just me. Perfect solution!
customer_reviews.author: Dave C.

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with this one
customer_reviews.text: Very simple coffee thing. Very good, especially for the long, cold Brew in my Mason jar, where it has the most time to extract the coffee from the bean. If you don't do coffee like that and want it hotter, maybe another product like the aeropress will work better.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey WXXX

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price, great coffee.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a broken ceramic one from Starbucks. This thing is SO MUCH BETTER than the one purchased from Starbucks! It is faster, easier to clean, and the coffee tastes better! The one from Starbucks would leak out of the sides of the mug when the coffee would drip. this one does not leak, it fits my #2 filters perfectly, and sits easily on the top of all of my mugs. Great product, great price, great coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Andy H

customer_reviews.title: Makes coffee taste wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Having been raised in Germany I remember women making the coffee with Melitta cones, most of them were porcelain. Plus making German coffee like that tastes so wonderful and brings back so many memories. This is what coffee should taste like to me, like real coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: It works Great for The Price... also it's unbreakable
customer_reviews.text: We like it... just remember the more coffee you put in the more top-heavy it is with the water.... that's why we use #4s the #2s don't Cut It Like The 4s You like the part that it's Unbreakable we broke the last ceramic one.
customer_reviews.author: SD Clark

customer_reviews.title: Use nearly every day
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, simple coffee maker, I use espresso roast and a tea kettle, and it makes great coffee. Just make sure you have a stable cup that fits correctly. Most coffee cups work fine. I don't suggest using the taller, thinner travel mugs.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Because it has only one small hole, therefore, the boiling water sits in the coffee grounds longer and picks up more flavor.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good cone because it has only one small hole, therefore, the boiling water sits in the coffee grounds longer and picks up more flavor. I bought this for my daughter who recently graduated from college and has to watch her pennies. Hopefully this brewer will encourage her to make coffee at home and discourage her from running over to the nearest Starbucks (and they are everywhere) to buy her coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Mystic Miraflores

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great
customer_reviews.text: If you're getting this for camping, then it's absolutely perfect. If you think this is going to make a substantially better cup of coffee than a good drip coffee maker, then I think you'll be disappointed. I was surprised at how quickly the water passed through the filter. I think my little coffee maker probably allows for the water to have longer contact with the grounds than this. I didn't find any great difference between the two. But I do plan to take this on my next camping trip. It's a great way to make coffee when you're roughing it.
customer_reviews.author: DJA

customer_reviews.title: Great to view water level in cup
customer_reviews.text: Great to view water level in cup with this product as you pour hot water over coffee grounds. Other "funnel" shaped products do not have a view of the cup's rising fluid level and you must pick it up from mug to view. This product solves that problem with a good functional design. An electric water kettle is a nice addition to making single cups of coffee this way for speed and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Marc G

customer_reviews.title: Good design and very convenient
customer_reviews.text: I had an old one of these, slightly different design, and the crotchety New Englander in me didn't want to upgrade for the newer one. But I got married and we needed another... Yes, this one's better. The gap at the bottom lets you see how full the cup is so you don't overfill. It's easy to use, super durable, and no need to clean a coffee pot when you want only one cup. I got another for my brother-in-law and now he takes it on the road when he travels for work.
customer_reviews.author: Songbird

customer_reviews.title: because this thing is awesome and so easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately my coffee maker broke a few weeks ago after 10 years of use and I am undecided on what type to buy. Do I want the type that I had or splurge and buy one of those fancy one cup at time brewers? So, I purchased this little gem thinking it would tide me over until I made my decision. (I'm still undecided) In all honesty, I think I might have saved myself some money, because this thing is awesome and so easy to use. Since I am the only coffee drinker in the house, it's really the best option out there and cheapest!
customer_reviews.author: M. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Ain’t nobody shanking me with my coffee dripper
customer_reviews.text: Needed plastic option for work in a correctional facility. Cause you know...murderers.
customer_reviews.author: James Kelly Speck

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! I use it everyday at work to make my coffee at my desk. If you drink more than one cup of coffee a day, you can use the same filter for a second cup. Just add more coffee to it and pour more hot water. If you try to use the same filter for a third cup, the grounds get too muddy and won't drain properly. This is a cost effective way to brew your own coffee and does a great job at it and well worth the price. Great for camping, home, work, etc. You could also use it for loose tea I imagine but I haven't tried that.
customer_reviews.author: T.G.

customer_reviews.title: New opening helps water flow easier, and upward side ...
customer_reviews.text: New opening helps water flow easier, and upward side for filter also aids flow and protects spillage of coffee and grounds, as size of bottom drainer is larger and more steady. Haven't had the top spill over since using new format.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Dickens

customer_reviews.title: Great and excelent Materials.
customer_reviews.text: Excelent product, stable (I'm in a vessel offshore), easy to use, clean and very good material. No problem about loosing temperature or spills because of the open sides. I would like thar the dripping were slower but anyway gets full flavors from the coffee and is excelent for the outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID MELENDEZ BRAVO

customer_reviews.title: Using now for filtering French Press made coffee
customer_reviews.text: Original review: For personal brewing, itt could be better if the water was allowed to reside longer in the coffee grounds because it makes weak coffee when brewed as is because it brews too fast in a matter of seconds. The hole in the brewer appears to be too large. Updated*** However, because this device did not work for personal brewing due to making weak coffee, I decided to use it to filter the coffee made from my French Press into the filter cup w/paper and into my mug. Now I get wonderful full flavored French Pressed coffee without the grounds in my cup! Fast and easy solution! The 4-star review is for using it as a filtering device...
customer_reviews.author: SweetTriks

customer_reviews.title: Still my favorite pourover single cup brewer
customer_reviews.text: Still my favorite pourover single cup brewer. The drip hole is small so that the coffee actually brews before the water passes into the cup. Watch out for other non-Melitta brands - some have such large drip holes that the coffee is flavorless because it just runs through. Only suggestion I would have is for the unit to be very slightly larger - the old Melitta I have is just a tad taller, which fits water for a large coffee mug a bit better.
customer_reviews.author: wallaby

customer_reviews.title: Warmed to it nicely!
customer_reviews.text: At first when I received this I was not happy with the design. I really liked the older one I had and wanted a duplicate of that. This one doesn't have a handle, and what was up with the open space underneath I thought? But after having used this one I have decided I really like it. You can easily lift it by the higher lip on one side of the cone, and the open area allows you to see how much coffee has gone into your cup without having to guess and lift the cone to check, so no more overflows when I guess wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Nevada Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Gadget!
customer_reviews.text: These things are great! I bought this for when I stay with friends who "don't believe in coffee," or their polar opposites who must only brew immediately after grinding, but sleep in. I just wanna' darn cup of joe first thing in the morning, what's the big deal? Now I can quietly boil water and avail myself of this simple creature comfort. I gave the last one to a friend with an RV, and am happy to upgrade to this model with the peekaboo window, nice feature! Actually think coffee made this way tastes a little better than coffee from my Braun...
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: A great standby and good friend for road trips or that long distance move when there's no access to your regular coffee maker. The Melitta Single Cup Coffee Brewer is the solution for any coffee addict. All you need is your coffee, any filter and boiling water (or very hot...in desperate situations) and you have your dream cup of coffee exactly as you like it. For some, this is a luxury; a piece of home away from home, no matter where they are. For others, it's a necessity. Who ever invented this is a genius. I can't imagine not taking this with me on my travels. "Don't leave home without it."
customer_reviews.author: Lita Perna

customer_reviews.title: so easy and quick!
customer_reviews.text: love this product and have purchased many of these for friends over the years. Just heat water, add a cone and coffee and pour through. Simple. Makes a great cup of coffee. No mess or messy cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: pastork

customer_reviews.title: We threw out our coffee maker after finding this
customer_reviews.text: We were tired of coffee machines that always started making gross-tasting coffee after a while, even when cleaned regularly. This is the perfect answer. It's affordable, simple to use, and always makes a perfect cuppa. I'm buying a second one now so the spouse and I can make coffee at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Supa D

customer_reviews.title: Brewed tasting coffee on the road
customer_reviews.text: A GREAT alternative to instant coffee when our trusty Keurig or electricity isn't available. We just grind our fresh coffee beans of choice, put them in individual measured packets (or in the filters if you're obsessive packers like us), pack up the Melitta Brewer/Filters & off camping we go ....it actually seems to brew quicker than the single cup Keurig in the hotels & smells like fresh brewed. It's light weight, compact & very efficient. You can see the coffee dripping so so don't overflow the cup with boiling water.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: A Great Buy for Single Cup Brewing!
customer_reviews.text: I already had one of these for home and now I have one at work! A wonderful, simple design that makes a great cup of coffee!!! There's even that great coffee aroma when it's brewing! Great Price Too!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Fischer

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing.
customer_reviews.text: I gotta say, I use this way more than my percolator and my keurig to make coffee. I can customize the strength of my drink and it only takes a few seconds to make (using the hot water from the Keurig). I use a reusable filter and I love this simple, yet effective gadget. Easy to wash and store and is way more convenient than any coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: MommaMelT

customer_reviews.title: Simple Perfection
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't get more simple and honest than this Melitta coffee maker. A cone of plastic with a see through window molded into the base and a slightly oversized lip at one edge to keep from scalding your fingers when you pour the hot water through your favorite coffee blend. Hmmmmh I got this for motorcycle touring and along with the copco 'faux take out cup' have assembled a perfect combination for traveling, or as it's currently being used, as an emergency back up until my electric kitchen maker dries out. It ain't fancy and it isn't a design winner in Berlin but ... it simply makes a great cup of coffee. (The price sure is right too ... )
customer_reviews.author: Dion Morse

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: We're not big coffee drinkers at my house, but when we do choose to drink coffee, having a well-made cup matters. This handy device allows us to brew a cup at a time quickly and easily; having an electric kettle is a big plus too. This product is much more cost-effective than those single-cup pod brewing machines, and it doesn't take appreciably longer. The brewing cone sits securely on your cup or mug. This is a simple way to get your morning cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hill

customer_reviews.title: This product is beyond fantastic. I use it almost every single morning
customer_reviews.text: This product is beyond fantastic. I use it almost every single morning! It makes the perfect cup of coffee in less than five minutes. This is one of the rare times that you find a product that is not only cheap, but extremely well built and fantastically functioning. I highly recommend buying one if you need a quick cup of coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Izaac Tompkins

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee decision in a long time.
customer_reviews.text: Use this all the time. Perfect size. Single hole in the bottom to allow coffee to brew a little longer by slowing the drip into the cup. The cut-away section near the base allows you to view inside the cup so you can see if it is full. A quality pour over kettle along with it, makes the perfect cup every time! Bought this kettle to go along with it - highly recommended:
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: Great cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: My son, the coffee expert, started using these at his house and I got a chance to try it out. Great cup of coffee. It takes about the same amount of time as brewing a cup, but much better flavor. And the price is certainly right! One caveat: It works best on regular ground coffee; when I used it with my fine ground Bustelo expresso, the coffee clumped at the bottom of the filter and it only made about half a cup. I liked it so much, I bought two...one for home and one for our vacation home.
customer_reviews.author: DrPsych

customer_reviews.title: Simple is good, and nice to see the progress of the dripping.
customer_reviews.text: After trying lots of different coffee-making gizmos, I'm back to the simple dripper. The coffee tastes very good, and cleanup is simple and unfussy (filter and grounds make good compost). I didn't think I needed to see inside the cup while it was dripping, having used old-style drippers for decades, but it really is nice to peek in there and see that you've poured the right amount of water. No more overflows on the counter with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Donald P. Ridgway

customer_reviews.title: Works OK For A Single Cup Of Coffee
customer_reviews.text: This single cup coffee brewers is not as compact as the previous Melitta version, but it works the same with a #2 cone filter. I like the ability to see when it's finished making without lifting the brewer from the mug. I'm not fond of the extruded-looking lip instead of a handle. It makes the whole thing unsymmetrical and awkward to hold. All-in-all I like the old design better.
customer_reviews.author: George Blackwell

customer_reviews.title: A simple way to make a great cup of joe
customer_reviews.text: A simple way to make a great cup of joe... Mix your coffee and hot water in a measuring cup. Let it steep 2 to 3 minutes then pour over the Melitta cone into your cup. Makes THE BEST cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: mdrhea

customer_reviews.title: I like the way this accepts filters and is easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: accepts all filters I have used to date as well as a fine micro-mesh one that makes having my morning coffee faster to drip. Do recommend,
customer_reviews.author: R.J. Sr

customer_reviews.title: WOW, I was not expecting this to be so good!
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this, it was for that lazy Saturday when I was the only one home and didn't need a whole pot of coffee. However the coffee (even the cheap stuff!) comes out so much better when I use this. (compared to my coffee pot at home & even against the Kurig I use at work). My household now uses this as its sole coffee maker!!! I use a plastic pitcher & add the hot water in smaller increments, letting it drain then adding a bit more water. it comes out so much richer than when i just fill it all the way up & let it drain only once. Best gizmo ever!!!
customer_reviews.author: SoupGirl72

customer_reviews.title: which is may more than normally recommended. I do wish that the hole was a ...
customer_reviews.text: I use one at work and at home to make coffee. I tend to fill the filter nearly full, which is may more than normally recommended. I do wish that the hole was a little smaller for a longer brew. It works well for a fine ground coffee, but you don't get the strength with the pre-ground stuff you get in the store.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Y.

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: I liked the design because you can how much coffee is being poured into your cup as it brews. Old design was poor.
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: Go plastic!
customer_reviews.text: This single cup brewer has revolutionized my coffee drinking habits. I love pour-overs---they are easy and delicious. I was using the Aeropress, but I kept getting my thumb stuck when I was releasing the coffee wedge at the end. This is seemingly just as foolproof. I do 2 heaping tbsp of coffee with 195-200F water. I adjust the amount of water based on how strong I want the coffee to be (I tend to do about 8-12 oz). This is great for traveling/camping, and goes great with #2 filters, which are readily available.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a pretty good little one-cup drip brewer
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty good little one-cup drip brewer. The downside is I can't just fill it and walk away to get ready in the morning, which is sort of what I was hoping for. I have to refill it 2-3 times nearly to the brim with hot water to make a single cup of coffee, and it can take a bit for the coffee to drain out so the whole ordeal is actually taking me more time than if I just used my regular drip coffee machine.
customer_reviews.author: Joe J.

customer_reviews.title: Old standby
customer_reviews.text: With a bottled water, the Melitta single brew, and the small microwave in our department, I'm set to practice my coffee snobbery at work. A mid-morning cup of my favorite brew is like a little gift. I also keep a single brew at home in the event of a broken carafe or the inevitable passing of my electric maker.
customer_reviews.author: WalksWithCats

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: So these are made in USA of hard plastic and they do not smell at all. The size fits over most average coffee cups. Easy to wash and transport. I plan on using mine while traveling as many hotel rooms have questionable coffee makers or outside the US will only have electric hot water kettles. This gadget will take care of the early morning there-is-no-Starbucks-nearby blues.
customer_reviews.author: Barbie Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great for occassional coffee
customer_reviews.text: I usually have coffee at work every morning, so I just wanted a solution to make a cup of coffee at home on the weekends. I thought about getting a Keurig but I didn't want the machine taking up valuable counter space. This is a perfect solution. Just microwave water for 2 minutes and then pour over the cone containing coffee grounds. I just throw the cone in the dishwasher when I'm done. Another benefit over the Keurig is that I can feed the filters and coffee grounds to my composting worms. I have a coffee machine that I get out when visitors come, so I can use the same coffee for both methods.
customer_reviews.author: AMC

customer_reviews.title: Not for a speedy cup of Joe
customer_reviews.text: I love coffee, but cannot have too much so I like to make one mug full. The pour method seemed the simplest way so I purchased these single brewers. They work exactly as they are supposed to and I can toss them in the dishwasher which is important for me. The only downside is that it does take some time to brew coffee using this method, so if you need a quick cup of coffee I would recommend a different brewing method.
customer_reviews.author: Tracee

customer_reviews.title: Great 1 cup without the Kcup price!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! Rather than pay for a very expensive k-cup type machine and even MORE expensive k-cup coffee, I just use this. I can make coffee as strong as I want. It's perfect for someone who likes a cup of flavored coffee but doesn't want to make a whole pot. Fits right over any cup I have, even wide rimmed ones. Size 2 filters are inexpensive and every grocery store carries them.
customer_reviews.author: TylerRose.

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and brew your own tasty brew!
customer_reviews.text: Buy this now. Skip the fancy coffee shop aka Starbucks. I bought two of these. One for work and one for home. Buy the peetnik bags of Peets ground coffee or the Sbux ground coffee at the grocery. Two tablespoons ground and some hot water and you've got a great cup or coffee that beats the lines, the interactions etc of having to stop for coffee. Save your money and brew your own tasty brew!
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to take camping instead of a large glass french press or french press camping mugs we had been using previously. It was perfect! It is lightweight plastic and the perfect accessory to make pourover coffee. It does take a little bit of time to make more than one cup, but so do other camping coffee-making options, and hey, you're camping, you've got plenty of time! This was a solid inexpensive purchase that will be a much appreciated additional to our camping kitchen gear.
customer_reviews.author: Vuoral

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This is the easiest way to make consistently tasty coffee. You can just rinse it after each use and let it dry out. You can also easily adjust the coffee strength by using more or less grounds. Simple and convenient!
customer_reviews.author: Letteratura22

customer_reviews.title: What's old is new again
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these (white ceramic with the Melitta logo in raised letters) for about two to three bucks when I was a young man. Lost it over the years, then got this one. Between the product cost and shipping, the total was ridiculous for a lightweight piece of plastic. But, it works fine. For those who observe it drains too quickly, pour it full and gently stir while it drains, then add the last of the water. Makes a tall travel mug for me. It also helps to have very finely ground coffee, or grind beans for each cup. Yum. Happy coffee drinking!
customer_reviews.author: C. P. Hendrix

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: These are just what you’d expect. I like how you can see the coffee filling the cup so you know when you’re full. I think I’ll eventually switch to a stainless steel one to keep from buying paper filters.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love this!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little coffee maker! I was pleasantly surprised at how fast and easy it is to have a great cup of coffee! My husband bought me some flavored coffee for Christmas, which he doesn't care for. So I bought this single cup brewer so I could have a cup of my special coffee whenever I wanted it. It's just the thing for me. I wish I'd discovered this before! I'll never buy instant coffee again!
customer_reviews.author: DebB

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little device for someone travelling and needing a brewed ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little device for someone travelling and needing a brewed cup of coffee but does not have room to put a coffee maker in the luggage. It makes good coffee, but the coffee comes out a bit slow. I have seen some models that have a slit all the way across the bottom. This one has one tiny hole, and coffee tends to cluster over that hole and block the flow a bit. All in all, it does work and will give you a good cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Basic equipment (that should cost less)
customer_reviews.text: We use these brewers all the time. They are over-priced for what they are. This one has one-hole and does not drain as fast as the kind that have three or four holes in the bottom. Not a problem for us as it just means the water is in contact with the grounds for a slightly longer spell.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Simple, and perfect
customer_reviews.text: A very simple product that helps you get a great cup of coffee. As someone else has suggested, you end up with a better coffee if first you stir the grounds in hot water (about 195-205F or 90.5- 96C), and then pour the mix in the filter. The quality of the coffee you make depends on the roast, grounds size, steeping time, and water temperature, so you may have to experiment a little bit, before achieving that perfect cup of Joe. As a nice surprise, the product is Made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: C. Robb

customer_reviews.title: Chasing dream
customer_reviews.text: It seems like every method of making coffee leaves me flat, as does the coffee they produce. This is kind of an involved process to use on a regular basis. Filters will cost a fair amount over time. In past experience the mesh ones did not work well, but I have not tried the one for this device. This would be good for camping or travel if you had to have a specific type of coffee to be happy. Maybe I will try a percolator...
customer_reviews.author: Carol Delves

customer_reviews.title: New model cone runs too fast
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had kept my old one safe from B; he thought it was too tired & tossed it before I got to review the new one. I use two filters to slow down the brew rate to make a good cup of coffee from the same amount of grounds I used in the old style. I don't care for the elevated cone; I make two cups at a time & the elevated cone lets the 2nd cup get cold before I can get to it.
customer_reviews.author: gail cooks

customer_reviews.title: Double the goodness
customer_reviews.text: Best to buy the two pack for another person as it takes time for the water to flow. Or Keep the 2nd one in case something happens to the 1st one.
customer_reviews.author: Yuck

customer_reviews.title: Makes a Great Cup of Joe at Work!
customer_reviews.text: This drip coffee contraption helps make me the most delicious single brew coffee at work! Durable and love the black exterior. Need not worry about unsightly coffee stains. Doubles as an all purpose female urinary funnel too! ;)
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: It works...kind of good
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple inexpensive device: insert filter, add coffee (lots of it) then pour in the hot water and you get a warm, not hot cup of coffee. Here are some tips: preheat the cup you will drink from, add lots of coffee in the filter, about twice as much as you think you will need, then if you want the coffee really hot put the cup in the micro wave. When it is all done you will have a better cup of coffee than I got from my expensive, and lasted less than two years, single cup coffee make. And by-the-way great for camping!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simply good
customer_reviews.text: Want something simple and good this is it...take a small amount of work but I use this everyday and make a fresh cup...small batch..less work less space..
customer_reviews.author: louis a dandrea jr

customer_reviews.title: Buying another for the house.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my RV but tested it out at home 1st.I think I'm going to get rid of my coffee pot. Makes a perfect cup of coffee and no leftovers coffee to throw down the drain. I use 3 scoops of grounds in my 14 ounce stainless steel mug that I bought at the same time leave enough room for a little cream and it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Nice pour through coffee brewer
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say about it, but it makes a great cup of coffee. Put a #2 filter in it, add your coffee grounds, pour hot water over it and you have hot delicious coffee. For anyone who is interested, it fits perfectly over this travel mug:  (this mug is the best travel mug I have tried!).
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great single-cup brewer
customer_reviews.text: The updated design here allows the coffee a second of exposure to air before it hits the cup. Previous versions have created a near-seal on the lid of the mug, so a lot of moisture built up. It's not a major breakthrough, but a slight improvement -- this one allows the coffee some "breathing room" on its way. It is probably better for the temperature of the coffee (it will be drinkable a minute sooner) and creates more "coffee aroma" in the kitchen area. Of course it now takes up a little bit more room in your cupboard.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel.S.H.

customer_reviews.title: Great for $6
customer_reviews.text: I like that it’s easy to store and clean. At first it started dripping very slow but over time it started flowing faster.
customer_reviews.author: Rubi

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I use this every day to make myself one cup of coffee. This is a great idea. I sit this over my cup and put in a filter and some coffee and pour hot water! The best freshest tasting coffee ever! You can control how much coffee and water. I gave half away as gifts and I kept the other half. When I am done, I throw it in the dishwasher and it comes out clean. It is much better than a coffee maker in my opinion. It doesn't take up room on your counter and you don't get limescale buildup. The only disadvantage is heating up the water before pouring but it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Best Cup of Coffee
customer_reviews.text: With this little brewer, I have made some of the best coffee. Now of course, I am also using very fresh whole beans. The way the grounded coffee "sits" in the hot water while it slowly drips down into the cup adds such great taste. This is definitely a little more time consuming than most methods, but I wouldn't have it any other way. Unfortunately you have to buy the Cone Coffer Filter #2 from Melitta. No other way around it.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: It works great. I just heat up some water
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the #2 coffee filters to use at work to make my morning coffee. It works great. I just heat up some water, place the Melitta on my coffee mug with a filter inside, add coffee grounds and pour the water in. Just like a drip coffee maker does - only it makes coffee one cup at a time so it's always fresh and made just the way I like it.
customer_reviews.author: G. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: good at what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: got this for work, but don't use it much. not working right now. it did as described. my buddy uses these everyday to make coffee. it uses a #2 cone filter which I use with my 4 cup brewer. I use a large coffee mug so I have not figured out how much water to pour in yet. if I used it more it would not be hard to figure this out. it does make a nice cup of coffee, if you use less water it will just make a stronger brew which I like so not an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: smtireman

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes simple is better
customer_reviews.text: We've had a Keurig for years, and I was really tired of plastic-tasting coffee. I bought a French-press and it is ok, but I honestly think the Melitta makes a better cup. With a press, you have to worry about the grind of the coffee and silt leaking through, but with the Melitta it's just a nice smooth cup everytime. 2 tablespoons of coffee in the filter per coffee cup, don't pour the water too fast, give it time to soak in.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S. Lindquist

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cup of coffee every time
customer_reviews.text: While I prefer french press coffee, sometimes it takes too long to prepare. The quickest and easiest cup of coffee is from this Melitta single cup brewer; one filter, one scoop of coffee and hot water from the electric kettle and I am out the door. Easy to clean too; dishwasher safe on top rack. I'm pretty excited about this little Melitta; use a gold cone filter and there is no trash except the coffee grounds, which go into the garden.
customer_reviews.author: JudyBug

customer_reviews.title: EASY PEASY
customer_reviews.text: The absolute best kitchen gadget to have, one easy freshly brewed cup of coffee
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Acevedo

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for non coffee fanatics
customer_reviews.text: Read a bunch of reviews to try to decide what to get for my later in the day cup of coffee as I didn't want to make a pot of coffee just for myself. Read up on all the fancy machines and drippers. Boy do some people take their coffee a tad serious! This one works great. I like to ability to see the level in the cup so I don't overflow with too much water. Works well and the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: RGB

customer_reviews.title: Good cup of coffee, cheap, convenient, easy to use/clean
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Super cheap and easy way to make morning coffee. Set up takes about 1 minute, and clean up takes about 10 seconds. It makes a good cup of coffee, but you have to make sure that the coffee is well ground otherwise the water will run straight through without absorbing enough coffee.
customer_reviews.author: rkrisel

customer_reviews.title: Innovative!
customer_reviews.text: I owned one of these in college. Recently purchased two of these as gifts for seniors who lived alone and found the new digital coffee brewers to be too complicated to operate. I don't drink coffee any more, but I just ordered one so that I could have it on hand in case one of my coffee drinking friends drops by and would like a nice, quick cup of coffee. I keep a small bag of Starbucks in the freezer and I'm ready for my guests. Clean up is a snap.
customer_reviews.author: Music Heals

customer_reviews.title: Very simple and very delicious coffee
customer_reviews.text: Keep it simple. Those are words to live by in life and they apply to this little manual coffee brewer. It makes consistent, full flavored coffee. It's simple to use, cleans up easily, and makes the coffee quickly. You don't have to worry about big bulky machines to tend to. All you need to do is put this device on top of your vessel of choice, put a filter in, add ground coffee, pour hot water and out comes coffee. Just remember 2 things - use filtered or bottled water and use quality coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K

customer_reviews.title: EASY, SIMPLY, JUST RINSE, ETC.
customer_reviews.text: WE HAVE THIS IN THE OFFICE. EASY, COMPACT AND SIMPLE TO USE. WHEN YOU HAVE A LITTLE SPACE THIS DOES WORK AND COMES IN HANDY. ALSO MADE UP A BASKET FOR SOMEONE AND PUT ONE OF THESE IN IT TOO.
customer_reviews.author: BASEBALL MOM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect camping accessory
customer_reviews.text: Perfect camping accessory. Went on my first camping trip in 25 years. I had to have my coffee and researched for a while what to get. This worked so well. Takes up no room to store. Boil some water and pour it over the filter and coffee grounds - instantly makes a cup of coffee. So simple and low tech.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Dee

customer_reviews.title: not so hot
customer_reviews.text: Had one of these years ago, and decided to buy it again. What I forgot is that in the short time it takes to drip your one cup of coffee, the coffee cools down considerably. Better to stick with a small drip coffee maker like Gevalia's, which will keep your coffee hot while it drips.
customer_reviews.author: a louis

customer_reviews.title: I love Melita and all their products
customer_reviews.text: I love Melita and all their products, this is no exception, its perfect for 1 cup just for me, or making a thermos for the day. also if you have multiple you can brew 2 cups. Easy to do and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Simple and works
customer_reviews.text: I give 5 stars because this products works well. However, this is never going to beat a french press or a top stove brewer. It could be used in combination with a french press to remove the grinds, in which case I recommend pre-wetting the filter (#2) with or without coffee, it doesn't really make any difference. Another thing I've test is doing a double filtration. It does give better coffee that a single pass, but requires twice as much coffee and two cups.
customer_reviews.author: lily

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little device for a quick, easy, fresh cup of coffee that almost tastes as good as Starbucks when I use their coffee. I will continue to work on the technique. My only complaint on this item and it is a minor one, is that I enjoy a strong cup of coffee for a 20 ounce cup and the brewing cup is barely large enough to hold all of the ground coffee. Other than that, this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: jdp

customer_reviews.title: More convenient new design
customer_reviews.text: Wow! It fits on top of my thermos bottle! Yay! I always use a melita coffee maker, but I've had many spills because the bottom of the filter holder didn't balance perfectly on some of my mugs. This newer version fits all my cups as well as the thermos bottle so I don't have to stand there holding it up while I wait for it to pour
customer_reviews.author: njani

customer_reviews.title: Fits over all of my VARIOUS shapes and sizes of cups and mugs. Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing! I love it. Makes a delicious cup of coffee in the time it takes the water to heat in your microwave. So inexpensive and useful. It works every bit as good as the electric single cup brewer I had; costs so little, and doesn't take up any space on my countertop! I am glad I purchased it. Would definitely recommend to anyone who likes just one cup in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: JoonMoon

customer_reviews.title: For the single cup coffee maven
customer_reviews.text: Had an old one for a long time and couldn't find this in the stores. It's exactly what I was looking for, since I don't use a pot of coffee and don't need an electric coffee-maker. I'm a coffee maven and am very happy they still make these things!
customer_reviews.author: Caren Vermont

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy fresh cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I had an old Melitta "pour-over" coffee brewer for years and recently, accidentally set it on a hot burner partially melting the plastic. I was happy to find the cup-top brewers are still available. The opening on the cup cover that allows a view of the coffee level in the the cup as it fills is an improvement over the older version. The pour-over brewer is a quick and easy way to make an always-fresh cup of coffee. The product was very reasonably priced--less than $5--and was delivered promptly using the Prime 2-day free shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Smith

customer_reviews.title: It's so easy to make a single cup of coffee and by ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this as an afterthought and since I bought it we've only used our Melitta Coffee brewer with insulated Caraffe once! It's so easy to make a single cup of coffee and by doing so, each cup is fresh instead of stale from sitting in a caraffe. Didn't think I would feel this way about a simple piece of plastic, but I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Todd Reagan

customer_reviews.title: Quick good coffee with a minimum of fuss in cleanup.
customer_reviews.text: Labeled as a single cup coffee brewer it still works for two plus cups. The pour-over method of brewing in a Melitta ready set Joe produces coffee almost as good as the French press method without the hassle of clean up of yucky coffee grounds -- with the Melitta cone these are gathered in the paper filter. You can experiment by varying the amount of coffee. I brew mine in a boro-silicate beaker, make it super strong then add hot water to taste. It's quick and efficient. Only the cone and the beaker to wash and keep sparking clean.
customer_reviews.author: ana a

customer_reviews.title: We use this because we hate having a coffee pot around with only one coffee ...
customer_reviews.text: We use this because we hate having a coffee pot around with only one coffee drinker. This particular one works so perfectly...I've had some where you almost have to run the coffee through twice to get the proper strength. Very few people have a home without a tea kettle so this process takes mere moments once you have the hot water. Really great to keep on hand for drop-in coffee drinker house guests.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Holloway

product_meta.title: Melitta Single-Cup Pour Over Coffee Brewer, Black
product_meta.description: Size:1 Count| Color:BlackOur founder, Melitta Bentz, invented coffee filters and pour-over brewing in 1908. For over 100 years, Melitta has remained a pioneer in coffee, coffee filters and coffee brewers. Our paper filters are 100% biodegradable. We offer filters for cone, flat bottom basket, percolators and Keurig single serve coffee brewers. Our filters are produced using chlorine-free white, natural brown and bamboo paper. In addition to filters, we offer a wide range of coffees and brewers including pour- overs, carafes, pour-over kits, coffee makers, kettles, drip coffeemakers, and even our own premium, batch-roasted coffee. Our coffee beans are sourced from farms located in prime coffee-producing regions. We batch roast and grind our beans extra fine in true European fashion - bringing out the coffee's full flavor. Enjoy our entire range of ground coffees, whole bean coffees, and single serve coffee pods.

SMART, CONVENIENT DESIGN: This pour-over's ingenious cone design allows you to monitor your pour & avoid overfilling.

THE BEST WAY TO BREW: Aficionados agree that pour-over brewing makes the best coffee. Just place a paper filter in the pour-over, scoop in your favorite coffee, pour hot water over the grounds & enjoy.
